transcript: <silence>
pi fala ong,# fala foka ong,# tahaa buti deitu natia, natet tahaa talama deitu natia.#
el dikang faala ma haba,# dikang mara,# beng mi ba,# tai hawel.#
tukda i ya,# hel te ya,# akui foka,# akui kiding,# pi tafuda paneang.#
el kaanra maiye, pi sei wai maiye, wai kaanra maiye pi lang taa.#
<silence>
we are recording the third task with Benny
this is the task listen in the person and the second person form is started now
<silence, unclear>

na taa ba iti ya, la heteitu, na taa ba iti ya, a miyei, nayongfi kaang-kaangdi ya, a miyei nateini ba ming naruida yo henile. @ENG@ I was sleeping and..., the first one now, I was sleeping on the ground, when you came, I was asleep, and you came and woke me up, like that. [na-teina = wake me up]
hmmm. Rofi. he'ayoku!, @ENG@ that's right. now the second one.

he'ayoku yo, el baai a maka natet ba mon yo hopuna ba iti ya, moku nuku dikaang pe mia ba hiena...., marakdi ba hiyeng mielangdi ba de'ui helaaki wei. @ENG@ the second one now. You were standing and holding a snake, a child that was nearby saw..., got scared by seeing it and stepped back
hare yal do aaa pining# pining ayoku do tewile?
jadi# hare edo mon mon hopuna, dikang me ba nele, na hen#
jadi Benny# Benny aaa yang

iya. na# iya. na# hare yal a mon hopuna ba iti ya nedo na# na la tukoi mon nu hiyeng mielang hare na hiyeng marakdi ba ne'ui helaaki. @ENG@ yes, I, yes, I, so now, you are holding a snake there and I, I am very scared by seeing the snake so I panic and step back
hmmm. rofi. @ENG@ that's right

aaaa hesua, a iti nabut ba natea ba iti to! a hetihai mahia re naha ye? @ENG@ ah, the third one, you are holding me up [embracing me and standing]. do you reckon it's heavy like that or not? [ba iti = sedang]
<laughing>. haaa.

hebuti, a nala la he'ompang-pange? a el mi ba bala hehaabi ba it to! wan a ming marakdi nu! iyeng kabei la mopi hal mai a iti ming marakdi ba el balei wahai, akunri re dara aari ye mai. @ENG@ the fourth one now. What are you thinking about? You are leaning against the wall. You shake suddenly. It looks like you are just a bit sleepy and shake suddenly awake and look around, is it dark already, or still daytime [mai = speech report].
hmmm. rofi. dikang @ENG@ right, and then

wan a e marakdi ba ming aruida ti wan ko war afeidi henil mai wan a aruidi ba wan efala re nahaba wan a olaake. @ENG@ when you suddenly woke up, it looked like it's gettting late, so you got up and went back home or whereever.
haaa.
hmmm.
na hewahai si, a iti natea ba it mai, na iti furai ba ok miyei so. wan na sei oopa mia. @ENG@ I saw that you are standing over there, so I run towards you. I came to you.

haaa. hel mia nu ko yang a# a ming beeka lol ba henu na iti atang hafiki ba: ai ang beeka lol hare me yo, mai. na iti atang hafik. @ENG@ this time, perhaps you are going the wrong way and I am pulling your hand saying: "Ai, you are going the wrong way, so come here" [speech report]. I am pulling your hand.

a atang awena pun ba iti ya, neyaafoka hu ang nateadi hare, wan na pa henir ba kabei la el tai furai har ba, lang oyaar ba na oro apiyet we nu. @ENG@ [awena pun = cakar pinggang, put hands on hips] You are standing with your hands on your hips and you are standing in the way [on the path], so it's like run you over a bit, just bump into you and walk on [passing you].
haaa.
<silent>
a iti maha futing natea ba iti. a war marang wahai we do @ENG@ You are standing in the yard, looking towards the east [absolute direction]
hmmm.
a ko yang nedo newahai re nala wala war marang nu mia ba a hewahai? @ENG@ are you looking at me or is there anything eastwards that you are looking at?
hmmm. wan kaanri. @ENG@ that's it
hmmm. kaanri. @ENG@ that's all.
